QEM Limited – Material Information Summary (ASX Announcement - 31 July 2025)

Capital Raising

  • Placement: Raised $2.05M (before costs) via issuance of 45.55M shares at $0.045/share, plus 22.78M attaching options.
  • Pending Settlement: $241.5K from associated parties remains unsettled (negotiations ongoing).

Leadership Change

  • New MD/CEO: Appointment of Robert Cooper (ex-MD of New Century Resources, Round Oak Minerals, BHP experience).

Project Milestones (Julia Creek Vanadium & Energy Project – JCVEP)

  1. Environmental Approval: Queensland Govt. finalized Terms of Reference (ToR) for Environmental Impact Statement (EIS).
  2. Cultural Heritage: Executed Cultural Heritage Management Plan (CHMP) with Wanamara People.
  3. Technical Progress: Beneficiation test work advanced with Core Resources and University of Queensland.

Financials (Appendix 5B – Quarterly Cash Flow)

  • Cash Balance (EOQ): $2.84M (up from $1.67M prior quarter).
  • Net Cash Used in Operations: ($530K) for the quarter.
  • Exploration Spend: $478K (quarterly), $2.0M (YTD).

Funding Runway

  • Estimated Quarters of Funding: 5.3 quarters (based on current cash and burn rate).

Other Material Updates

  • Grant Secured: Collaborative Development Program (CDP) grant for vanadium electrolyte plant design (terms under negotiation).
  • Resource Metrics: JORC Resource confirmed at 2,870Mt @ 0.31% V₂O₅, with contingent oil resources (6.3–654 MMbbls).

No material information omitted.

Material Information Summary

1. Key Exploration Results – Red Mountain Lithium Project (Nevada, USA)

  • Drilling Highlights:
  • RMDD003:
    • 32.4m @ 3,260ppm Li (1.74% LCE), incl. 8.6m @ 5,060ppm Li (2.69% LCE) (highest-grade intercept to date).
  • RMDD005: 80.8m @ 860ppm Li (0.46% LCE), incl. 9.1m @ 1,350ppm Li (0.72% LCE).
  • RMDD007: 95m @ 1,340ppm Li (0.72% LCE), incl. 5.4m @ 2,320ppm Li (1.24% LCE).
  • Metallurgical Testwork:
  • Low-grade test: 36.3% mass reduction, 22% Li grade increase, 77.8% recovery.
  • High-grade test: 51.8% mass reduction, 38% Li grade increase, 66.6% recovery.

2. Needles Gold-Silver Project (Nevada, USA)

  • Review Highlights:
  • Identified four drill-ready targets with historical high-grade gold/silver workings.
  • Notable rock chip results:
    • Eastern Shaft: Up to 33 g/t Au and 622 g/t Ag.
    • Tomahawk Shaft: Up to 5.54 g/t Au and 406 g/t Ag.

3. Corporate & Financial Updates

  • Capital Raising:
  • Placement: $5.5M raised at $0.015/share (366.7M shares).
  • Share Purchase Plan (SPP): Up to $500K offered to existing shareholders.
  • Cash Position:
  • Quarter-end cash: $314K (down from $1.68M prior quarter).
  • Estimated funding runway: 0.2 quarters (post-placement proceeds expected to extend this).
  • Exploration Spend (Quarter): $1.26M.

4. Other Material Updates

  • Governor Broome Project (WA): No work this quarter; exploring divestment options (JV/trade sale).
  • Board Change: Resignation of Non-Executive Director John Young (31 May 2025).

Conclusion:
- Lithium results reinforce Red Mountain as a high-grade discovery with metallurgical upside.
- Gold-silver targets at Needles present near-term drilling potential.
- Capital raising addresses short-term liquidity needs; post-placement funding to support further exploration.

Next Steps: Maiden Li resource estimate (Red Mountain) and Needles drilling.

(Omitted: Routine operational details, non-material corporate updates, and historical project backgrounds.)

Eclipse Metals Ltd (ASX: EPM) – Quarterly Report Summary

Material Information for Trading/Capital Markets Decisions

1. Operational Highlights
- Grønnedal Rare Earth Resource Upgrade:
- Inferred MRE increased to 89.2Mt @ 6,363 ppm TREO (567,600t contained TREO), a 70x increase from maiden resource.
- High-grade intercepts (e.g., 20,092 ppm TREO over 0.3m) confirm depth potential.
- Metallurgical Results:
- Up to 54% REE recovery via flotation; magnet REEs (Nd, Pr, Dy, Tb) comprise 33–39% of TREO.
- Strategic Advantage: Greenland location offers deep-water access, grid power, and ESG benefits for EU/US supply chains.

2. Corporate & Financial
- Capital Raising: $2M placement at $0.015/share (oversubscribed, including $500k from existing shareholder).
- Cash Position: $2.127M at quarter-end (Appendix 5B).
- EU Strategic Project: Ivigtût under review for EU Critical Raw Materials Act status.

3. Legal & Other Risks
- Legal Dispute: Writ of summons from Pioneer Resources (NSW Supreme Court); company disputes claim.

4. Exploration Expenditure
- $64k spent on exploration (Greenland focus).

Brevity Note: Excluded non-material operational details, director names, and jurisdictional boilerplate. Focused on valuation-impacting data.

Appendix 5B Key Metrics
- Cash Flow: Net operating outflow of $191k (quarter); financing inflow of $1.725M (placement proceeds).
- Funding Runway: ~11 quarters based on current cash.

IMEXHS Limited – Q2 FY25 Activity Report & Appendix 4C Summary

Financial Highlights

  • Q2 FY25 Revenue: $6.6m (-3% YoY; +1% ex-one-off).
  • 1H FY25 Revenue: $13.7m (-1% YoY; +4% ex-one-off).
  • Underlying EBITDA: $0.2m (Q2), $0.3m (1H).
  • Cash Balance: $2.5m (vs. $2.1m at Dec-24).
  • Debt: $1.3m (up from $1.2m at Dec-24).
  • Capital Raising (Apr-May 2025): $2.6m total ($1.5m Placement, $1.0m Director Placement, $0.1m SPP).

Operational Highlights

  • New Contracts: Won Neurológico de México tender ($206k ARR); secured 3 AQUILA+ deals ($30k ARR).
  • Partner Program: 25 partners in 15 countries (40.6% of Q2 software revenue vs. 15.5% FY24).
  • Pipeline Growth: Boosted by Colombia Congress of Radiology attendance and targeted webinars.
  • Cost Reductions: AI-driven call center automation, renegotiated cloud costs, headcount cuts.

Outlook & Guidance

  • FY25 Revenue: $27.5–28.2m (+4–6.6% YoY).
  • Underlying EBITDA: $1.3–1.6m (vs. $0.5m pcp).

Key Risks

  • Colombian Healthcare Reforms: Policy uncertainty impacting payment cycles.

Cash Flow (Appendix 4C)

  • Operating Cash Flow (Q2): $0.1m.
  • Financing Cash Flow (Q2): $2.0m (capital raising proceeds).

Consensus: Weak near-term collections offset by cost controls and growth in ARR (+11% YoY). Liquidity stable post-capital raise.
